comment: Dr. Holliday was one of the best professors I have ever had. I had her in-person class at the tail-end of COVID and she was very lenient but was always willing to help us learn the material. Most of the time, the work was fairly easy. As a math person, I was very successful in this class, but if you are not, I would recommend rethinking your major.
rating_tags: Caring--Test heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Holliday is extremely unclear in her grading criteria. She is also very unexplicit about due dates. There are no due dates listed on the syllabus & no course schedule. She does not give any feedback on written items that are graded. No video lectures only very paraphrased PowerPoints. The final project was difficult with minimal direction.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: She made learning discrete math very easy for me. Everyone always talks about how hard this class is, but I didn't experience that. She taught the material through online lectures, and then used class time for games like Kahoot or Gimkit to reinforce what we learned. I found her teaching style to be very interesting. She goes off topic quite a bit.

professor Holliday did her lectures through videos that you were supposed to watch and the in class time was spent playing games to solidify the content learned in lectures. The class was easy but felt like I had to memorize a lot rather than understand why I was doing something. Sometimes professor Holliday wouldn't explain it so well.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment:
She is the best professor to learn discrete. You would be a complete and utter fool to not take her. It would be an astronomical blunder. She is delightful to hear lecture, she is respectful of our time and mental health, and she's a good mix of weird and funny. 
To get an A: participate in class, look over problems in the book, and pay attention.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Caring

comment: Best discrete maths professor ever. The topics were pretty fast-paced if you took this during the summer, but she makes the concepts/topics very interesting with her video lectures. The topics included truth tables, the 21 laws, proof writing, etc. The homework problems helped prepare you for the quizzes and tests. Overall this class was a blast.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Online Savvy

comment: I took this class over the summer and there was an assignment due every 4 days. It is a lecture heavy class but I felt that her lectures were interesting and informative and I appreciate that she always transcribed them. Overall youll have to put in a lot of work but shes not a tough grader
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class--Lots of homework

comment:
Pros: Her class was (mostly) straightforward (work the difficult problems, so her's aren't as intimidating). She was accessible outside of class. The homework is for practice NOT a grade. She gave extensions when requested.
Cons: Going to class was for practice NOT lecture (you were expected to have watched the videos PRIOR to the start of class).
rating_tags: Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Honestly, this is one of the worst teachers I might have ever had in my many years of learning. she isn't a bad person but she is too focused on being a funny person than a good teacher. If you're into that then go ahead. She is a really lenient grader and you can get a good grade just for trying a problem but you will only learn by yourself.

HEAVILY UNDERRATED. Recorded lectures but has her live lectures reserved for any questions. So caring, she always understands if something happens. HW is optional but you better do it because it helps. 1 of11 quizzes dropped, 4 Tests and 1 exam. She uses the most bizarre examples to make the course easier to understand. 100% can't go wrong with her
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy--Caring

comment: She is one of the best professor I've had at Kennesaw State University. Discrete Math is a hard class and you have to work for your grade but her lectures are very clear, she makes it fun and relaxing, and she is definitely not a tough grader. She is an exceptional teacher definitely a 5/5.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Honestly, her prerecorded lectures suck for Discrete Math. She is either mumbling or getting off subject while recording the videos. I recommend a power point instead. The proctored tests are annoying because you cannot use pen and pencil but she wants you to explain how to graph a problem using muscle memory. Smh just all bad!
rating_tags: Get ready to read

comment: Class was structured as follows: watch prerecorded lectures, do homework, come to class with any and all questions, then take your quizzes/tests. The only really hard thing about this class is learning how to think in a different way - if you do the work you will have an A or a B. She is a very fast grader which is amazing in the summer!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: This "professor" the worst I have ever experienced. She expects you to teach yourself all the material before her sessions and the lectures she does record is such a pain to follow. I understand this class is not supported to be easy but she made it way too much harder than it had. Avoid at all costs.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Prof. Holliday is quirky and nerdy which makes lecture interesting. I do not feel like I really learned well from her tho. You were expected to know the material before the zooms. I learned from YouTube, smart center, etc., and I went off her expected way of doing the problem sometimes. Her pre lecture vids sometimes helped andshe grades leniently.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: I would only recommend taking her if you are really good at math, specifically if you were really good in Calc 1. The only perk is that homework is optional and not for a grade. You have to basically teach yourself the entirety of the material as she only works out examples during class. Tests are worth 60% of your grade.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dont let her quirky and funny first impression fool you, her class spiraled down into total chaos. You are expected to know the material before you show up to the zoom session which consist of an hour and 40 minutes of working through a few examples. Your grade is based on 4 tests a final and final quizzes at the end of almost every week. Avoid!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Save yourself the stress and do not take her. She expects you to know everything before you show up to her zoom session where all she does for an hour and 40 minutes is work through different examples. Homework is optional and your grade is based on Tests, Quizzes and the Final. She offers no opportunities for extra credit and does not curve. RUN!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Her class is worse than an SI session. She expects you to learn everything from her vague recorded videos BEFORE you show up to class where all you do is problems. You are only graded on 4 tests, 10 quizzes and a final, no homework, no curve, no extra credit, no grade drop. Scored low on one out of 4 tests and my average dropped from A to low B.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Do not take her if youre having her class online. Everything is a pre-recorded lecture where you cannot ask questions and you are expected to watch them before class. Her 1 hr/40 min classes are just SI sessions. I had to look completely elsewhere to learn the material.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Please do not take this teacher at any cost. She doesn't care to help students that are actually putting in effort . Very nonchalant and shows no emotions when asking for help. Pre uploads videos and you only come to class to work out problems. You will teach yourself and spend 15+ hours a week studying because she does not say what she wants .
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Due to the pandemic her classes are long SI Sessions where you are expected to fully understand the concept before arriving to class. In other words, to do well you have to fully teach yourself EVERYTHING. If your taking more than 12 credits run and save your GPA because this class will easily require 12+ hours minimum per week of studying.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Got stuck with her after my original teacher retired . Clear to say this was the worst decision I couldve made . Types her math notes into a discussion post instead of writing it down . -_- All grades come come from test and quizzes. YOU TEACH YOURSELF. Save yourself the stress and MENTAL HEALTH & take LITERALLY any other professor but her .
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Her "classes" are only glorified SI sessions. She only covers practice problems in class and expects you to come to class having viewed pre-recorded class lesson lectures. All points come from 4 tests, the final, and a handful of quizzes.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor Holliday would have been less difficult had the class been in person and not online (for question purposes) . I found myself teaching myself most of the material and only sometimes had a clear grasp of a topic. You have to show all work on quizzes and tests, which is really the least of it. Overall, you work for it.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: I dont usually rate my professors, but this one I have to. She is so hands off, are grade is all test and quizzes no homework. Shes not good at replying to my emails especially the ones about my concerns. Flexible office hours though. She is extremely hard at grading.... lets just say this I got a 95 last math class but I got a 50 on 1st quiz.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: I basically had to teach myself everything for this course. The only "instruction" she provided was scanned images from an old textbook. We never even met for lectures to work out problems together. HOURS spent working on ALEKS homework that isn't even counted for a grade. Super hard quizzes. Never take this professor. Run for your life!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: She knows her stuff, but you need to be able to put in the effort to know the material. She only teaches the steps of how to do problems and then examples of them. Her grading is justified(thought i got a 30 on the 1st test... got an 82). The partial points help a lot. I took 3/4 this course in quarantine. It was rough but I was able to keep the B.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: Her lectures are not very entertaining. She tries to put in some jokes once and it's fine for a bit but ultimately, her tests are really hard. Calc 2 is already a hard class and she will throw trig functions that we didn't talk about in lecture at all and doesn't give warnings about them. It's just unnecessarily hard and no calculators allowed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Doc Holliday is hilarious. The subject matter is one of the easiest of a 3000 level math course, and she covers everything well in class. She kids with students, makes the lectures interesting, and there are no surprises. She takes up written homework half the weeks of class, few quizzes, and final. Someone would have to make an effrt to fail
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: I took this course over the Summer in hopes that my previous experience with Trig. would make this an easy A. This class IS NOT an easy A, the tests are not difficult but, they require immense willpower as every step of your work must be shown. Additionally, the homework covers far more material than the tests do making it a bit excessive.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Took trigonometry as an online summer class and it was one of the best online classes I have taken. The way she sets up the modules actually allows you to learn and her quizzes and tests are not hard, just make sure you know the basics and remember formulas. She was nice and has graded homeworks but they actually help you grasp the concepts.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Taking online trig with her and Ive emailed her 5 times over the semester and havent heard back from her once, tried KSU mail & D2L and NOTHING. Thank god Im doing fine in the class but if I needed serious help Id be screwed! Her quizzes/tests are straightforward but you have to explain EVERY step and it takes SO long. Dont take her online.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: I took College Trigonometry over the summer which meant the workload was expected to be fairly heavy but, the reason I am rating this professor so poorly is due to the requirement that you show every step of your work on every assignment, an 18 question test took me 4 hours to complete!!!!!! and, I already took Trigonometry in high school.....
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took this class during the summer and online, so it was work heavy as expected and Professor Holliday isn't a bad prof. but her class is tough. She requires you to show all of your work on quizzes and tests which slows you down and takes her forever to grade manually and she gives no feedback. Take another professor if you can.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: Prof Holliday is a kind, caring, and eclectic woman. She's one of my favorite math professors I've ever had. That being said, her class is HARD. I took her take-home quizzes to the SMART center tutors and they were frequently stumped. If you need to really understand calc then take her. If you just need the credit then go for someone easier.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: I love Dr. Holliday! She uses quirkiness to keep your attention. She's very caring and wants students to succeed. I liked her class because it was straight forward. Do the homework and you'll do well. The homework is same as tests. She's the best! I'll miss her!
rating_tags: Inspirational--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Easy class, very straightforward about topics and specifics you need to know. Tests are just like the practice examples she uses in class. Very entertaining sarcastic and dry sense of humor. Very knowledgeable and willing to help you. If you have the chance to take her I highly recommend I looked forward to this class everyday she was so funny.
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--Hilarious--Clear grading criteria

comment: She teaches about incredibly irrelevant things. She spent the first 10 mins of every class showing us pictures of her cat or showing a cat mouse pad on the board. She teaches like you already know the information and gives irrelevant practice questions. DO NOT take her. Her quizzes and hw is super easy, unlike her tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is funny. HW is easy vs the tests, but isn't graded. 50 or so HW problems a day, you won't know what to practice. The tests are horrific, she combines several problems into one. It makes them almost impossible to get right,she does give partial credit. Few quizzes based on HW. Tests are 80% of grade. Rushed unhelpful explanations outside class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--TEST HEAVY

comment: You either hate or love her. Teaches like you already know the material which is obviously unhelpful but will gladly answer questions when asked. Will waste class time on irrelevant problems and "jokes". Gives you almost no idea what is on any of the tests, but 2-3 of the problems will be repeated on the tests. Don't take unless you have no option.

Very confusing teacher. She would write all the problems on the board and solve them without even explaining the steps. You are going to  wind up teaching yourself the material with this professor. She can be funny, but she can also be very sarcastic and rude when asking her for help, which can be very frustrating.

Dr. Holliday is the perfect professor for math nerds because she is one. Tips for getting an A: Do the homework and do the homework. You will not pass this class by mere attendance. If you can do the problem yourself, you will ace the tests. Her grading system and tests are straight forward, lectures engaging, and her socks are ever changing :-)
I took calc2 from her and she is an amazing, helpful teacher who wantts everyone to get a good grade.  Awesome professor.

Took for Calc 1; class was really confusing and I was lost the whole time. She does a lot of the work in her head and she doesn't use notes; she writes everything on the board and erases as she goes. She gives pop quizzes and homework every night from the book. Tests come from homework problems. Dry sense of humor and sarcastic, likeable lady.
She is a genius, but she doesn't thoroughly teach the material. She only works problems on the board and expects you to understand the information. Look for a better option if possible.

She is very helpful, explains everything clearly. she is by no means an easy teacher but you WILL learn. Any math class I need I try to take with her, my main reason is she is quirky and cracks jokes the whole class meaning its hard to not pay attention. She also helps with the pumpkin launch and the LGBT organization.

Holliday is soo awesome! Her jokes are so bad that they're funny. She's just a genuine math nerd but you have to love her for that. Her tests are problems done in class and problems from the homework,although the homework is not mandatory. She actually does curve the final so its actually pretty easy to pass her class as long as you pay attention.

First off she is a good teacher, she says jokes only 2 people laugh at, she gives a few quizzes and tests and collects attendance.  She makes it more fun and easier than most but a tutor may still be needed.  I recommended her however.

Holliday is my favorite math teacher. She loves to joke around, but can explain calculus in a way that is so easy to understand. She doesn't drop tests or curve grades, we had 4 tests and 4 take home quizzes, those were our only grades so don't play around. She is the best math teacher by far in my opinion. I'm taking her for every math class I can

Holliday is one of my favorite professors.  She is the "funniest professor you will never laugh at" meaning that she makes funnies all the time, but the setting isn't right for a laugh.  She teaches well, is incredibly smart, and doesn't throw curve balls on the tests.  God bless her...

She is beyond sarcastic and fun to listen to. It made the otherwise quiet classroom something I looked forward to sitting in. There is a quiz every day in summer semester to keep your grades up. That is if you actually study. :) Thumbs up. Trying to get into my next course with her~!

She is a good professor. No real problems. I was doing pretty poorly in the beginning but had to buckle down and it wasn't that bad. She is funny, and has an odd sense of humor, but good professor none the less. Just take as many notes and examples that she rights. Trust me, you'll need it for the exams. She does give review questions before test!

**$**very nice sense of HUMOR (if u're into giggles).her method of gradin is the complete OPPOSITE(mor cut throat).Hence, its very hard to get an A in her class (most std wer failin).Some Practice questions on the handout is VERY similar to wat wil b on the test. she expects u to rember AL TECHNIQUES USED fr as far as coll. algebra, SO DONT FORGET!
Best Instructor I have taken in the math department.  If you do the take home homework(quiz) it is no way to fail her classes.

She is a great teacher. she does a good job in making you understand the steps and procedures involved. i really love her sense of humor though. she is so funny. Remember to do a lot of practice homework and show all work on the tests. she doesn't curve either.what you make is what you get.
she is hard and really sarcastic she is very stubborn if you ask her why you got questions wrong on a test
I had her in supplemental class, where I had to work in teams, but I would go to her for extra help when possible. Her examples were really clear an understandable.

her for stat her examples in class is real elementary which makes it easy to understand her test questions are put in an elimentary text she has hw assignment for each section but she never takes it up. two class periods before the test is when she will give you a hw assignment u have to turn in. its november and only had one quiz so far

Her explanations are very good in tutoring, but during class she wasn't as willing to explain things. During the labs we were expected to learn from our teammates, but sometimes none of us had a good grasp on the material.

She is the most interesting, helpful, and nicest professor I've had yet at southern polytech. It's ok to be a few minutes late, and it's fine to not show up as long as you let her know beforehand. She's great when it comes to explaining the material, and she really knows her stuff. If you have a problem, it's her goal to clear it up, which she can!

A great professor! Math isn't my best subject, but with her it was made clear and the instruction was great. Not effortless (what math is, really?), but just doing the homework leads to a comfortable grade.

One of the best professors I've had in any subject! She is very willing to work with you during office hours, something I took advantage of all the time. Do the homework, pay attention in class and ask any questions. Those three things are almost guaranteed to get a decent grade. I hope I can take her for the rest of my math courses.
Never been a math head. Got my second highest math grade ever in her class. Not an "effortless" class, but clear and doable with normal study.
She is interesting and fun and is always willing to help you understand, but she will not work the problems for you. She makes sure you actually learn. Good preparation for Math 1113!!!
DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS. SHE RUN THROUGH THE MATERIAL SO FAST THAT YOU CAN NOT KEEP UP. HER FINAL HAD EVERYTHING FROM THE BEGINING OF THE SEMESTER ON IT!!! IF YOUR SMART YOU WONÃ¢??T TAKE HER CLASS!!!

Moves too fast, her classes are at least 3 sections ahead of the other classes.  Expects you to remember everything from all prior math classes. very dorky. Doesn't give formula sheets for integrating, some other professors do.  Good thing is her problems on quizzes and tests are not that hard because she doesn't give formulas & calculators allowed

I'm not sure why the other poor ratings. Doc Holliday knows her stuff and expects you to learn it. It's Calculus, do you really expect to learn it in your sleep?! Difficult tests aren't a sign of poor instruction, but more likely a reflection of poor study. This class took up hours per day, but Doc Holliday was always a great instructor.
took her for math 2254, got a D after studying everyday for hours. retook the class with another teacher and got an A. her tests are too hard and the homework is a time sink.

Please do not take her because i  have had her over the summer for 2253 and asked for help so many times and all she does is make you feel dumb for not knowing the material. And everyone is right about her quizes being nothing like her lectures. She failed me after constantly asking for help and begging for extra credict.....

Great teacher loves ninjas, just go to class, and at least understand the homework concepts.  Very interactive with students, don't be a smart butt, but ask questions.  Class is kinda like JUMANJI, a new adventure everytime!

AVOID AT ALL COST, WORST TEACHER I HAVE EVER TAKEN, YOU WILL WORK YOU BUTT OFF, BE HIGH IN THE CLASS ONLY TO FAIL. SHE IN CONDESENDING AND USELESS OTHER THAN HER 50 MINUTES OF SEWAGE. AVOID AT ALL COST

Worst teacher I ever had!  She makes a very hard class seem almost impossible.  Quizes are take home and will always come on fridays so you will spend hours of your weekend on them.  She is very unfair on grading.  I got every problem right on one of her test but she still gave me a 66 because I didn't show all my work.  STAY AWAY FROM!!!
do not take her. She acts insane and does not really respect her students.

She is an intering teahcer. She knows her material very well but examples in class are nothing like the ones in the homework or tests. She talks down to people who ask her for help and lots of people drop her class. Unless your great at math I don't advise taking her.

Do not take. Quizzes and tests are much harder than any of the homework. No curving and most of the class will drop or fail. Take-home quizzes will take several hours so you wont have time for any other classes. New concepts aren't explained fully. If you ask questions at her office, expect to be treated as an idiot.

Horrible, STAY FAR AWAY. She is a complete jerk and touts her power over students by unfairly playing God with grades. She is absolutely impossible, and her grading is about as ambiguous as it comes. Thanks for failing me when I deserved a pass.....

I have her in two classes back to back. She's a great teacher but expects you to do your part to.  Grading is fair and doing well is easy as long as you take interest and put forth an effort.  I'm taking her class again next semester I hope!
